basics.name: Nil Crespo Peiró
basics.label: Data Scientist & Computer Vision Researcher (AI for Sports)
basics.summary: Data Scientist and Computer Vision Researcher applying AI to sports, combining academic research with industry experience. PhD researcher at Deutsche Sporthochschule Köln working on AI-driven tracking for 3x3 basketball, and Visual Computing Developer at AiBall improving player and ball tracking in padel.

work.name: Deutsche Sporthochschule Köln
work.summary: AI-driven tracking and analytics for 3x3 basketball.
highlights: Developing deep learning and machine learning algorithms for automated player and ball tracking in 3x3 basketball
Extracting player trajectories and game events from single-camera video setups
Collaborating with analysts and coaches from the German Basketball Federation (DBB) to design analytics solutions
Leading creation of a large-scale open-source tracking dataset for 3x3 basketball
Applied sports AI research across basketball, ping-pong, cricket, and golf

work.name: Arcvi / AiBall
work.summary: Computer vision pipelines for scalable tracking in padel.
highlights: Enhanced and executed CV deep learning pipelines on AWS using GPU-enabled instances
Improved tracking accuracy and computational efficiency via model optimization and pipeline refinement
Designed internal data systems managing large volumes of tracking data using Amazon S3
Developed web-based dashboards for visualization and operational reporting
Implemented camera calibration and automated alerts for unwanted camera movement
Integrated multiple reservation providers to automate bookings across platforms

work.name: Hewlett-Packard (HP)
highlights: Parsed highly unstructured data to extract business value
Designed and managed complex data flows
Used predictive algorithms to increase company revenue

work.name: Barcelona Dragons

Developed pre-game analysis using recorded KPIs
